image.altText: A woman with crossed arms leaning on her car.

items.synopsis: Millions of Australians face the daily frustration of delayed commutes, particularly on busy motorways. But as governments spend billions continually upgrading roads, experts say that might not be the best solution.

title.children: Highway congestion is starting to bite. How do we get cars off the road?

image.altText: Composite image of a cathedral on the left with blue sky in the background and a man in bishop's vestments.

items.synopsis: Gerard Holohan departs after more than two decades in the role and following significant workplace disputes in recent years.

title.children: Pope accepts resignation of high-ranking WA Bishop

image.altText: Real estate agent puts up a sold sticker after this Mosman apartment sold at auction.

items.synopsis: Sydney, and particularly the most expensive areas within it, is leading a national house price rebound. But can it survive further interest rate rises and a possible recession?

title.children: The 'real danger' confronting property markets as house prices continue to rebound

image.altText: Nat Fyfe walks on the field with one shoe on wearing a pained expression

items.synopsis: Dockers stalwart Nat Fyfe suffers a stress fracture in the same foot that he injured earlier this year, sparking fears he may have played his last game for season 2023.

title.children: Cruel blow for Fremantle as Nat Fyfe suffers stress fracture in foot

image.altText: A calculator to the right of frame reads 67063, while paper, a highlighter and pen are in the background.

items.synopsis: Four WA politicians have pocketed thousands of dollars in extra salary for being members of a parliamentary committee that has not met once during this term of state parliament.

title.children: WA taxpayers fork out $67,000 as four MPs paid thousands for committee that hasn't met in two years

image.altText: A woman with dark braids wearing white tennis outfit hits the ball with her racquet.

items.synopsis: In a move designed to alleviate anxiety for players on their period, women competitors now have the option of wearing dark-coloured undershorts at the iconic tennis tournament.

title.children: For players on their periods, Wimbledon's all-white dress code has been a source of anxiety — until now

image.altText: the outside building of a company

items.synopsis: Embattled consulting firm PwC Australia sacks eight senior partners linked to the use of confidential Treasury briefings.

title.children: Former chief executive among eight partners sacked over PwC tax scandal

image.altText: A Matildas player smiles as she celebrates scoring a goal against the USA.

items.synopsis: Veteran striker Kyah Simon has capped a remarkable comeback and earned selection in the final 23-player squad for this month's Women's World Cup.

title.children: Kyah Simon returns as Matildas announce Women's World Cup squad

image.altText: Grain terminal view as grain pours out of machine onto pile.

items.synopsis: Russia's UN envoy says it has no incentive to maintain a deal allowing vital grain to be exported from Ukraine through the Black Sea, and one of its politicians claims Moscow has now taken 700,000 Ukrainian children out of conflict zones.

title.children: Moscow questions Black Sea grain deal, says 700,000 Ukrainian children now in Russia

image.altText: An angry looking man glances down from a balcony.

items.synopsis: Brendon McCullum indicates England could skip post-series beers with Australia, with his side furious over the Jonny Bairstow stumping at Lord's on day five of the second Test.

title.children: McCullum hits out at Australia over Carey stumping, as footage emerges of Bairstow trying the same dismissal

image.altText: An elderly woman wearing a red shirt smiling and a dog being held by its owner

items.synopsis: Ada Holland was "full of life and vigour", a loved member of her family and a respected member of the Vincentia community before being set upon by dogs, an inquest hears.

title.children: Inquest hears dogs that fatally attacked 90-year-old woman were unregistered, 'malnourished'

image.altText: An aerial shot of a large crowd in front of a huge stage at an outdoor festival.

items.synopsis: The Out Of The Woods festival drew thousands to the tourist hotspot of Busselton last year. But 12 months on organisers say a lack of accommodation and rising costs have forced its move to Fremantle.

title.children: Music festival that brought thousands to WA town switches location after single year

image.altText: Man standing in front of garden fence.

items.synopsis: Until the National Disability Insurance Scheme arrived in Mildura in 2019, Chris Riordan couldn't even live in the house he owned. Now it has the assistive technology to support him.

title.children: Chris thought the NDIS would be just 'another fizzer'. But for him, it turned out to be a 'game-changer'

image.altText: A screenshot showing Australian cricketers walking through the Lord's Long Room, with Usman Khawaja talking to a member.

items.synopsis: The final day of the second Ashes Test at Lord's is filled with drama thanks to Ben Stokes, a rarely seen stumping of Jonny Bairstow and "disappointing" abuse from the Lord's members. Here are five big moments from a dramatic finale.

title.children: Five quick hits — Bairstow's stumping against the 'spirit of the game' and Khawaja confronts Lord's members

image.altText: A group of shearers shear sheep

items.synopsis: Western Australia's wool industry is worth $650 million, but growers say it will shrink rapidly if live exports are stopped.

title.children: End of live trade could have 'catastrophic' consequences for wool industry

image.altText: Jarrod after being moved to a bed in the emergency department at Caboolture Hospital, red rash around mouth and cheeks

items.synopsis: Queensland Health launches a second review into the wider paediatric system at Caboolture Hospital in the wake of the repeated misdiagnosis of a baby boy at the hospital last year.

title.children: Queensland Health launches second review into Caboolture Hospital

image.altText: Celine Cremer smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Efforts to find a missing Belgian tourist will now turn to swift water searching at a remote waterfall in Tasmania, a week after she was reported missing — with authorities working to "find some answers for Celine's family".

title.children: Last ditch attempt 'to find answers for Celine's family' a week after Belgian tourist reported missing

image.altText: Woman in green jumper, measuring tape against brick composite image

items.synopsis: The Laneways Rosebery apartments in Sydney's inner south were spruiked as an "urban sanctuary", but since 2021 remain empty after ongoing delays in meeting rectification orders.

title.children: Claudine bought a Sydney unit two years ago. She is still waiting to move in

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and glasses looks seriously at the camera while holding a young girl with curly hair in the living room.

items.synopsis: The federal government is spending $5.4 billion to reduce the childcare costs of about 1.2 million families. But with high inflation and quirks in the system, there's concerns some parents won't see much savings.

title.children: 'A minefield': Why the childcare subsidy policy means some parents will get more than others

image.altText: Hampers are packed inside the Foodbank warehouse in South Australia, October 16, 2017.

items.synopsis: Demand for food relief across Western Australia has substantially increased over the past four years and children in regional areas are among those most in need, a report has found.

title.children: Children among those most in need as food insecurity rises, report finds

image.altText: The black stone exterior of the RBA building in Sydney.

items.synopsis: Three of the big four banks believe the Reserve Bank of Australia will increase interest rates at its meeting tomorrow, while Australian house prices continue to rebound.

title.children: RBA expected to lift rates at July meeting, PwC partners 'fell short' of expectations, ASX finishes higher — as it happened

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti-corruption commission

items.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission commences with a full workload, as people waste no time making referrals, and the commissioner Paul Brereton makes a promise to take every complaint seriously.

title.children: National anti-corruption commissioner promises to be 'fearless but fair', revealing 44 complaints already received

image.altText: A close-up shot of a woman holding a phone with a financial trading account on the screen.

items.synopsis: The federal government says Australians are facing a "scamdemic", with investment scams costing us over $1billion per year.

title.children: Taskforce to target fake investment schemes amid 'scamdemic' costing Australia billions

image.altText: A wide shot of players walking off a field.

items.synopsis: As Australia claims fans tried to trip players walking off the Lord's field for lunch, the MCC confirms it has suspended three members for their behaviour during the final day of the second Test.

title.children: Australia claims fans at Lord's attempted to trip players coming off the field, as the MCC confirms suspension of three members

items.synopsis: If the whale is confirmed to be albino, it will be only the second confirmed case along Australia's east coast — and citizen scientists are urged to be on the lookout.

title.children: Photographer 'in awe' after capturing footage of possible albino humpback calf

image.altText: A woman in sunglasses and a mask outside an Adelaide court.

items.synopsis: Kristin Danger is sentenced to two years of home detention for falsely claiming $93,567 from the disability support pension while she was working at SA's Mobilong Prison.

title.children: Former prison officer avoids jail over $94,000 disability payment scam

image.altText: a globe with arrows pointing to Australia, and dollar signs on each one

items.synopsis: Going overseas used to be a reprieve from paying off your HECS-HELP loan, but that loophole has been closed since 2017. So how much has been recovered since?

title.children: HECS-pats: Australian grads abroad owe $1b in debt, and it's about to go up

image.altText: A selfie of Danielle Easey in a kitchen.

items.synopsis: The witness also told the court he feared for his own safety after being shown Danielle Easey's lifeless body at a home in Narara on the NSW Central Coast.

title.children: Key witness in Danielle Easey murder trial says accused hinted 'he did something bad'

image.altText: An airport sign displaying information about cancelled flights.

items.synopsis: Virgin Australia customers are believed to be the most affected, as delays and cancellations continue at Sydney Airport.

title.children: Domestic travellers left stranded after four days of cancellations at Sydney Airport

image.altText: A woman sitting in a house.

items.synopsis: Apartments and townhouses make up nearly 30 per cent of homes in Australia, and some owners are feeling blindsided by strata fees which have climbed by up to 45 per cent in the past year.

title.children: 'I'll probably have to sell the place': Andrea felt blindsided when her strata fees went up by 45 per cent

image.altText: Daryl Maguire closeup.

items.synopsis: The former MP accused the media of "serious" privacy invasion after the corruption watchdog report was released last week.

title.children: Daryl Maguire responds to ICAC report finding 'serious corrupt conduct', denies all allegations

image.altText: A burnt out white car on the back of a large tow truck on a French street.

items.synopsis: The grandmother of the teenager shot dead by police during a traffic stop in a Paris suburb says she wants the rioters to stop, as the home of a Paris suburb mayor is ram-raided and set alight.

title.children: Wife of French mayor undergoes surgery after fleeing from home rammed by car and set alight
